explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 1) a piece of information given to people by using a loudspeaker or microphone, esp. at an airport or railway station 广播通知
explanations_and_examples.example: This is an announcement for all passengers traveling on the 9:25 flight to Rome.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) an important or official statement （重要或正式的）通告，公告，布告
explanations_and_examples.example: The minister made the announcement that he was to retire the following month.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] 普通话
[U] the state of being successful, esp. financially 兴隆； 发达；繁荣；昌盛
explanations_and_examples.example: A country's future prosperity depends, to an extent, upon the quality of education of its people.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE also urbanise) cause to take on urban characteristics 使城市化
explanations_and_examples.example: The area has been urbanized these years.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) using or involving a lot of effort, people, supplies, etc. 大规模的
explanations_and_examples.example: We must improve our response to large-scale natural disasters.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE also mechanised) using a machine to do sth. that used to be done by hand 机械化的
explanations_and_examples.example: Modern mechanized equipment has enormously reduced the number of personnel needed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: many 许多的；很多的
explanations_and_examples.example: He has been late on numerous occasions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: making you feel extremely tired 使人精疲力竭的
explanations_and_examples.example: All of us who have raised children know how demanding and exhausting it can be.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also soundproofed) not allowing sound to go through 隔音的
explanations_and_examples.example: Regular sounds of everyday living can be heard through a poorly soundproof wall.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a small enclosed box-like space that a person can go into 小隔间
explanations_and_examples.example: I called her from a public phone booth near the entrance to the bar.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE marvellous) extremely good, enjoyable, impressive, etc. 极好的；绝妙的；了不起的
explanations_and_examples.example: We've achieved some marvelous results with this new drug.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: extremely beautiful or attractive 非常漂亮的；极其吸引人的
explanations_and_examples.example: There is no denying the fact that this film looks absolutely gorgeous.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. pl.];sth. pretty that you put onto sth. else in order to make it more attractive 装饰物
explanations_and_examples.example: We put up the decorations at the beginning of the holiday.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) extremely good, large, or great 极好的；极大的
explanations_and_examples.example: The wildflowers will be incredible after this rain.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) impossible or very difficult to believe 难以置信的
explanations_and_examples.example: It seemed incredible that people would still want to play football during a war.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: only 专门地；独家地；仅仅
explanations_and_examples.example: Instruction in these subjects in undergraduate classes is almost exclusively by lecture.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) an increase in the value of goods or services produced and sold by a business or a country 增长；发展
explanations_and_examples.example: The company is preparing for zero growth this year.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) an increase in amount, number, or size 增多；增长；增大；增强
explanations_and_examples.example: We've seen an enormous growth in the number of businesses using the Web.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who starts their own business, esp. when this involves risks 企业家
explanations_and_examples.example: He would not have succeeded in such a risky business if he had not been such a clever entrepreneur.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the shape made by hills or buildings against the sky 天际线
explanations_and_examples.example: You get a good view of the New York skyline from the Statue of Liberty.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (esp. AmE) a wide main road that joins one town to another 公路
explanations_and_examples.example: The interstate highways are usually faster, but smaller roads can be more scenic (景色优美的).

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a business or project in which two or more companies or individuals have invested, with the intention of working together 合营企业；合资企业
explanations_and_examples.example: The company has set up a joint venture with a firm in Austria.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (AmE) (usu. before noun) expensive and of high quality 高档的；高端的
explanations_and_examples.example: John Lewis is a high-end department store that operates throughout the UK.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (technical) an aircraft without a pilot but is controlled by sb. on the ground 无人机
explanations_and_examples.example: Drones have opened up a lot of possibilities for photographers

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make a continuous low dull sound 发出持续的嗡嗡声；嗡嗡作响
explanations_and_examples.example: Above him an invisible plane droned through the night sky.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (virtual reality) an environment produced by a computer that looks and seems real to the person experiencing it （计算机构筑的）虚拟现实
1) a piece of head-worn equipment designed to see computer images or images from a camera in front of your eyes 头戴式视图器
explanations_and_examples.example: This VR headset allows you to enter a whole new world, all from the comfort of your own home.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a set of headphones, often with a microphone attached （常指带麦克风的）耳机
explanations_and_examples.example: This Bluetooth headset is very easy to use.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the way you think about sth. and your idea of what it is like 认识；观念；看法
explanations_and_examples.example: There is a general public perception that standards in schools are falling.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the process of taking action or making changes that you have officially decided should happen 实施；贯彻；执行
explanations_and_examples.example: Very little has been achieved in the implementation of the peace agreement signed last January.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also innovatory) using new methods or ideas 新颖的；创新的；革新的；采用新方法或新观念的
explanations_and_examples.example: Big companies are always looking for innovative products that can't be easily copied.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U, sing.] the state of depending on a particular person or thing 依靠；依赖
explanations_and_examples.example: The study program concentrates more on group work and places less reliance on lectures.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very large in size, amount, or number 巨大的；可观的；大量的
explanations_and_examples.example: If you are a major sports star or top bank executive, the rewards are massive.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) used to describe the average amount of sth. in a particular place, calculated according to the number;of people who live there 人均的；平均每人的
explanations_and_examples.example: The significant increase in per capita income offers the potential of new markets to serve.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: move or develop more slowly than others 落后；拖后
explanations_and_examples.example: He's lagging behind — we'd better wait for him to catch us up.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: certainly or definitely; unquestionably 确定无疑地； 毫无疑问地
explanations_and_examples.example: She is an artist whose work will undoubtedly withstand the test of time.】

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very poor 贫困的
explanations_and_examples.example: He devotes himself to creating sustainable solutions for impoverished people in Africa.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make a serious promise to yourself or sb. else 立誓；起誓
explanations_and_examples.example: The president has vowed to help the earthquake victims.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a serious promise 誓言；誓约
explanations_and_examples.example: Jim made a vow that he would find his wife's killer.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: get rid of sth. completely or destory sth. bad 根除；消灭
explanations_and_examples.example: The disease has now been successfully eradicated from the world.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the situation or experience of being poor 贫穷；贫困
explanations_and_examples.example: There are many areas where the problems of poverty and unemployment still persist.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very pleasing or attractive 迷人的；有魅力的；有吸引力的
explanations_and_examples.example: There are lots of charming little restaurants along the river.】

explanations_and_examples.explanation: ask sb. a lot of questions 询问；查问；盘问
explanations_and_examples.example: Four men have been quizzed about the murder, but no one has yet been charged.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (pl. quizzes) a competition or game in which people have to answer questions 问答比赛；智力竞赛
explanations_and_examples.example: The club has weekly quiz nights.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) study or describe the history, development, or progress of sth. 研究...的历史；探索...的发展；追寻...的轨迹
explanations_and_examples.example: The book traces the changing nature of the relationship between men and women.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) find sb. / sth. that has disappeared by searching for them carefully 仔细找寻
explanations_and_examples.example: Police are trying to trace a young woman who was seen near the accident.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (yawning gap / gulf / chasm) a very large difference between two groups, things, or people （两者之间的）巨大差距
explanations_and_examples.example: There exists a yawning gap between rich and poor.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) open your mouth wide and breathe in deeply because you are tired or bored 打呵欠
explanations_and_examples.example: They looked bored and couldn't help yawning.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: a person who was born in the 1980s, 1990s, or early 2000s 千禧一代
explanations_and_examples.example: Millennials have grown up with the Internet and can't imagine a world without it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: talk or think about pleasant events in your past 谈论， 追忆（快乐的往事）
explanations_and_examples.example: We sat side by side, reminiscing about the past.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: feeling sad because you do not want to do what you are doing 遗憾地；惋惜地
explanations_and_examples.example: I must regretfully decline your invitation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: say sth., esp. about sth. you have just noticed 评论，谈到，说起（尤指刚察觉的事）
explanations_and_examples.example: Anderson left the table, remarking that he had some work to do.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: sth. that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed 言论；意见；评论
explanations_and_examples.example: He made a number of rude remarks about the food.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a fact or an event in nature or society, esp. one that is not fully understood 现象
explanations_and_examples.example: Language is a social and cultural phenomenon.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) sb. / sth. that is very unusual because of a rare quality or ability that they have 非凡的人（事物）；奇才；奇事
explanations_and_examples.example: The Beatles were a phenomenon — nobody had heard anything like them before.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a very large number of things produced at the same time 大量涌现；迸发
explanations_and_examples.example: Technology is offering us an outpouring of opportunities that will help us stay curious and creative.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) an uncontrolled expression of strong feelings （强烈感情的）流露，倾吐
explanations_and_examples.example: The news of his death produced an instant outpouring of grief.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: happening or done in a natural, often sudden way, without any planning or without being forced 自发的；自然而生的；一时冲动的
explanations_and_examples.example: The audience broke into spontaneous applause.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a feeling of great surprise 吃惊；惊奇
explanations_and_examples.example: Much to the amazement of her family, she left school to pursue her acting career.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) develop and change gradually over a long period of time 逐步形成；逐渐演变
explanations_and_examples.example: Computer software will continue to evolve in response to users' needs.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (of plants, animals, etc.) change gradually over a long period of time （植物、动物等）进化，进化形成
explanations_and_examples.example: More complex animals gradually evolved from these very simple creatures.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a condition of life that causes difficulty or suffering 艰苦；贫困
explanations_and_examples.example: People suffered many hardships during that long winter.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. sing.] a reduction in economic, business, or other activity （经济、商业等活动的）下降，衰退
explanations_and_examples.example: There is evidence of a downturn in the housing market.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (abbr. p.a.) (fml.) for each year 每年
explanations_and_examples.example: The country exports goods worth $600 million per annum.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) only 唯一的
explanations_and_examples.example: The story was published with the sole purpose of selling newspapers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) sb.’s ability to do sth. 能力；才能
explanations_and_examples.example: They are worried about their capacity to invest for the future.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) the amount of space a container, room, etc. has to hold things or people 容量；容积；容纳人数
explanations_and_examples.example: The newly-built theater has a seating capacity of 2,000.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a child or young person 孩童；年轻人
explanations_and_examples.example: These courses are specially designed for youngsters aged seven to nine.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having a lot of experience of life, and good judgment about socially important things such as art, fashion, etc. 见多识广的；老练的；练达的
explanations_and_examples.example: Mark is a smart and sophisticated young man.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the way in which a person or a group of people lives and works 生活方式
explanations_and_examples.example: Many people are trying to adopt a healthy lifestyle these days.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) different from other people or things; doing things in your own way 特立独行的；独特的
explanations_and_examples.example: His music is highly individualistic and may not appeal to everyone.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) believing that what individual people want is more important than what society or the government wants 个人主义的
explanations_and_examples.example: A more individualistic society is also one with much more loneliness.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having the qualities that are needed to succeed as an entrepreneur 具有创业素质的
explanations_and_examples.example: The successful candidate will be an entrepreneurial, goal-oriented problem solver.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) sure that you have the ability to do things well or deal with situations successfully 有信心的；自信的
explanations_and_examples.example: I feel much more confident about myself and my abilities these days.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (not before noun) sure that sth. will happen in the way that you want or expect 确信的；有把握的
explanations_and_examples.example: We are confident next year's profits will be higher.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: fairly large, esp. large enough to have an effect or be important 相当大的（尤指能产生影响或很重要）
explanations_and_examples.example: Considerable progress has been made in finding a cure for the disease.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: frightening in a way that makes you feel less confident 使人气馁的；吓人的
explanations_and_examples.example: They were faced with the daunting task of restoring the house.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) understand or deal with sth. difficult 理解，应付（困难复杂的情况）
explanations_and_examples.example: This outlook helped her navigate through her later years with success.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) find which way you need to go while traveling from one place to another （为...）导航，指引方向
explanations_and_examples.example: There weren't any road signs to help us navigate through the maze of one-way streets.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) believe or say that sb. / sth. has a particular quality 认为...具有...的特征
explanations_and_examples.example: People were beginning to attribute superhuman qualities to him.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) believe or say that a situation or event is caused by sth. 把...归因于...
explanations_and_examples.example: The fall in the number of deaths from heart disease is generally attributed to improvements in diet.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (infml.) knowing a lot about sth. and able to make good judgments about it 有见识的；在行的
explanations_and_examples.example: She bought the laptop on the advice of a computer-savvy friend.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (infml.) practical knowledge and ability 实际知识和能力；见识
explanations_and_examples.example: He's obviously got a lot of political savvy.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: supporting new or modern ideas and methods, esp. in politics and education （尤指在政治和教育方面） 进步的，先进的
explanations_and_examples.example: We're looking for progressive ideas to move the company forward.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) think of sth. in a particular way or as having;a particular quality 认为；视为
explanations_and_examples.example: These buildings are deemed to be of architectural importance and must be protected.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE self-centred) tending to think only about yourself and not thinking about the needs or feelings of other people 自我中心的；自私的
explanations_and_examples.example: She sounds totally self-centered and is showing you no consideration.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: feeling that you have the right to do or have what you want without having to work for it or deserve it, just because of who you are （由于自身身份）认为应得的，有权利的，有资格的
explanations_and_examples.example: The college attracts both the entitled children of wealthy parents and many scholarship students.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) the act of buying and using products 购买；消费
explanations_and_examples.example: These products are not for national consumption, but for export.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) the amount of energy, oil, electricity, etc. that is used （能源、油、电等的）消耗量
explanations_and_examples.example: The government is determined to reduce the UK's total energy consumption.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (forecast, forecast; forecasted, forecasted) say what you expect to happen in the future 预测；预报
explanations_and_examples.example: They forecast a large drop in unemployment over the next two years.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a statement of what is expected to happen in the future, esp. in relation to a particular event or situation 预测；预报
explanations_and_examples.example: The weather forecast said it was going to rain.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. pl., U] a strong desire to have or achieve sth. 强烈愿望；志向；抱负
explanations_and_examples.example: When I was 12, I had aspirations to play professional basketball.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) in addition to what has already been said 此外；而且；不仅如此；更有甚者
explanations_and_examples.example: She always arrives on time; furthermore, her work is always excellent.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (electronic commerce) the business of buying and selling of goods and services on the Internet 电子商务
explanations_and_examples.example: Travel companies have moved from the traditional bricks-and-mortar (实体的) environment to e-commerce.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: influenced by the most fashionable styles and ideas 时髦的；受新潮思想影响的
explanations_and_examples.example: He writes for some trendy magazine.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a fashion, game, type of music, etc. that becomes very popular for a short time 时尚；一时的狂热
explanations_and_examples.example: If history is any guide, this latest diet for losing weight is just another craze.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having a lot of money or enough money to have a good standard of living 有钱的；富裕的
explanations_and_examples.example: They worked long hours and became very well off.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used for stating a particular standard sth. can reach 达到（某个标准）
explanations_and_examples.example: I didn’t think last night's performance was up to her usual standard.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: completely full of 充满...的
explanations_and_examples.example: This book is packed with useful information.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: use sth. to discover if it works or if you like it 试用；试验；检验
explanations_and_examples.example: Don't forget to try out the equipment before setting up the experiment.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: fall behind 落后于
explanations_and_examples.example: Prices are rising sharply, while incomes are lagging far behind.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: when compared 相比之下；比较起来
explanations_and_examples.example: In comparison to other recent video games, this one isn't very exciting.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: apart from 除了...以外
explanations_and_examples.example: Are you studying any science subjects other than chemistry?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used when you are comparing two things or people and saying that the second one is very different from the first 和...形成对照；相比之下
explanations_and_examples.example: The company lost $13 million this year, in contrast to a profit of $15 million last year.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used for talking about the ways in which two things are different, or about the ways in which sth. has changed 相比于
explanations_and_examples.example: Unemployment in the region currently stands at 10.1 percent, as compared to a national average of 7.7 percent.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (figuratively) resonate with; feel emotionally relevant to 与...产生共鸣；与...产生情感联结
explanations_and_examples.example: If this story spoke to you, I very much want to hear from you.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 旧金山（美国城市，位于加利福尼亚州）
特斯拉（汽车品牌）
沃尔玛（连锁零售商）
墨尔本 (澳大利亚城市，位于维多利亚州)
walk or travel, usu. for a long time, with no clear purpose or direction 闲逛；漫步；漫步于
explanations_and_examples.example: Tigers once roamed far and wide across much of Southeast Asia.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: walk slowly across or around an area, usu. without a clear direction or purpose 徘徊；闲逛；漫步于
explanations_and_examples.example: After lunch he wandered aimlessly around the shopping mall.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having or showing strong feelings of love or of anger, etc. 感情强烈的；热情的
explanations_and_examples.example: Sarah was greeted with a passionate embrace by her husband and children at Heathrow Airport on returning to London.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [sing.] the edge of the land that is next to the water in a port 码头边；坞边
explanations_and_examples.example: The dockside was the busiest place he had ever seen.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C, U] the act of people coming together after they have been apart for some time 团圆；重逢
explanations_and_examples.example: It was a very emotional reunion, for the children weren't allowed to see her for nearly a week.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C] a social occasion or party attended by a group of people who have not seen each other for a long time 聚会
explanations_and_examples.example: We all look forward to our class reunion, an awesome celebration with old friends!

explanations_and_examples.explanation: serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of sb.'s behavior 严厉的；严格的；苛刻的
explanations_and_examples.example: The prime minister gave a stern warning to those who were on strike.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) marked by worry and distress; troublesome 令人烦恼的
explanations_and_examples.example: Mr. Royama and others are likely to find the coming week a very fretful one indeed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) anxious and complaining, and unable to relax 烦恼的；发牢骚的
explanations_and_examples.example: The boy appeared fretful and disappointed that he couldn't join the others on their trip.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who has been forced to leave their country, esp. during a war, or for political or religious reasons 难民；避难者
explanations_and_examples.example: The refugees were packed shoulder to shoulder on the boat.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having or supplied with too much of sth. 超载的； 超负荷的
explanations_and_examples.example: More than 10 people were killed after an overloaded bus crashed into a pond.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a small boat carried by ships in order to save people if the ship sinks （船上备用的）救生艇
explanations_and_examples.example: The captain ordered all passengers and crew into lifeboats.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a boat that is sent out to help people who are in danger at sea （海上）救生艇（船）
explanations_and_examples.example: Sam's dog was saved by a lifeboat during the incident on Tuesday afternoon.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) single; unique 单个的；独一无二的
explanations_and_examples.example: She always thought of herself as singular, as his only daughter.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) of or relating to the form of a word used when referring to one person or thing （词形）单数的
explanations_and_examples.example: Can you tell me the singular form of this noun?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 双层公共汽车
[C] 风车；风车磨坊
[C] (BrE pavement) 人行道
[sing.] your ability to understand a complicated idea, situation, or subject （对复杂想法、状况或问题的）理解力，领悟力
explanations_and_examples.example: Steve has a good grasp of European legal system.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: take and hold sth. firmly 抓牢；握紧
explanations_and_examples.example: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also ~ up) (AmE line, line up) form or join a line of people or vehicles waiting to do sth. or go somewhere 排队（等候）
explanations_and_examples.example: People are queuing to get in from seven o'clock in the morning.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (AmE line) a line of people waiting to enter a building, buy sth., etc. or a line of vehicles waiting to move （人或车辆为等候而排的）队，行列
explanations_and_examples.example: All of a sudden a woman elbowed her way to the front of the queue.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: to or at any place, position, or situation 无论去哪里； 无论在哪里；无论什么情况下
explanations_and_examples.example: Wherever you choose to live, there are always going to be advantages and disadvantages.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: arranged or organized in a sensible or neat way 有条理的；整齐的
explanations_and_examples.example: She put all the letters received in the last two years in three orderly piles.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) struggle or compete with other people to get or reach sth. 争夺；抢夺
explanations_and_examples.example: Thousands of people will be scrambling for tickets.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (always + ad. / prep.) climb up, down, or over sth. quickly and with difficulty, esp. using your hands to help you （迅速而吃力地）爬，攀登
explanations_and_examples.example: She scrambled down the tree as quickly as she could.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: on or onto a ship, plane, or train 在船（飞机、 火车）上；上船（飞机、火车）
explanations_and_examples.example: Given the early hour, the train was not crowded at all, with only about 30 passengers aboard.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: on or onto a ship, plane, or train 在（船、飞机、 火车）上；上（船、飞机、火车）
explanations_and_examples.example: After all the troubles, they finally went aboard the plane.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: with the top at the bottom and the bottom at the top 倒置地；颠倒地
explanations_and_examples.example: To get the plant out of the pot, turn it upside down and give it a gentle knock.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a sudden strong desire to do sth. without thinking about whether it is wise to do 冲动；突然的欲望
explanations_and_examples.example: Mary felt a sudden impulse to play some music.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (cause to) move up or away after hitting a surface （使）弹起；（使）反弹；（使）弹跳
explanations_and_examples.example: The ball bounced twice before he could reach it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (AmE humor) the ability to find things funny, the way in which people see that some things are funny, or the quality of being funny 幽默感；幽默
explanations_and_examples.example: Even a speech on a serious subject should be delivered with a little humour.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (pl. Swiss) 瑞士人
(the ~) [pl.] 西班牙人
1) (fml.) cause a particular feeling or reaction 引起； 激起
explanations_and_examples.example: This product has excited a great deal of media interest.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (not in progressive) make sb. feel happy, interested, or eager 使兴奋；使激动
explanations_and_examples.example: His playing is technically brilliant, but it doesn't excite me.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having qualities that are typical of a child 孩子般的；像孩子似的；天真无邪的
explanations_and_examples.example: All her life she had a childlike trust in other people.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not knowing information or facts that you ought to know 无知的；愚昧的
explanations_and_examples.example: They remained ignorant of the troubles that lay ahead.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that can be trusted or believed 可靠地；可信赖地
explanations_and_examples.example: The website helps you find what you want faster and more reliably.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: put sb. / sth. in danger of being hurt, damaged, or destroyed 使处于险境；危及
explanations_and_examples.example: We must be careful not to do anything that might endanger the economic recovery.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C, usu. sing.] a particular way of life 生活；生活方式
explanations_and_examples.example: Surfing the Internet has become part of our everyday existence.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [U] the state of existing 存在；实有
explanations_and_examples.example: The organization has been in existence for 25 years.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 打扫房间的女工；（尤指宾馆里的）客房女服务员
[C] (BrE) a small paper or cardboard container in which goods are packed for selling （装商品的）小包，小袋，小盒
explanations_and_examples.example: Could you please kindly bring me a few packets of biscuits?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: smell sth. by taking air in through your nose 嗅；闻
explanations_and_examples.example: She put perfume on her wrist and sniffed it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: breathe air into your nose noisily, for example when you are crying or have a cold （因哭泣、感冒等）抽鼻子
explanations_and_examples.example: We all had colds and couldn't stop sniffing and sneezing.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: confuse sb. or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand sth. 使困惑；使迷惑
explanations_and_examples.example: The findings of the survey puzzled me — they were not at all what I would have expected.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 拼图游戏；拼图玩具
attract sb. and make them like you, sometimes in order to make them do sth. for you 迷住；吸引
explanations_and_examples.example: We were charmed by the friendliness of the local people.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a quality that makes you like or feel attracted to sb. / sth. 魅力；吸引力
explanations_and_examples.example: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, the 1937 Disney classic, has lost none of its original charm.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (infml.) a photo you take of yourself, esp. using a mobile phone 自拍照
explanations_and_examples.example: em>I believe posting a new selfie online every day isn't necessary.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: move lightly or quickly and not stay in one place for very long 轻快地行进；掠过
explanations_and_examples.example: In the fading light we saw bats flitting around in the garden.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] sth. interesting or enjoyable to see or do 吸引人之物；有魅力之物；诱惑物
explanations_and_examples.example: The beautiful beaches are the island's main attraction.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C, U] a feeling of liking sb., esp. in a sexual way 喜爱；喜欢；（尤指两性间的）爱慕
explanations_and_examples.example: The attraction between them was almost immediate.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the written form of a speech, play, film, etc. （演讲的）原稿，讲稿；（戏剧、电影等的）剧本
explanations_and_examples.example: This actor has only just been handed the script and knows little about the show.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (usu. before noun) too many to be counted 无数的； 数不清的
explanations_and_examples.example: I've heard the song played countless times on the radio.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the skill, job, or process of producing photographs 摄影术；摄影业；摄影
explanations_and_examples.example: After I went on a photography course, my friend asked me to take some photos of her.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a structure made of wood, metal, plastic, etc. that surrounds sth. such as a picture or window, and holds it in place 框架；边框
explanations_and_examples.example: Sharon kept a photograph of her mother in a silver frame on the kitchen wall.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (BrE also standardisation) the process of making things of the same type all have the same basic features 标准化
explanations_and_examples.example: Cars have been subjected to a good deal of standardization in matters concerning safety and pollution.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a book that gives information for visitors about a place, such as a city or country 旅行指南；旅游手册
explanations_and_examples.example: We booked hotels in advance, since the guidebooks said that they tended to be busy.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (esp. of a place) attractive in appearance, esp. in an old-fashioned way （尤指某地）美丽的，古雅的， 如画的
explanations_and_examples.example: We booked a trip to a picturesque village in Switzerland at the very beginning of the ski season.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a small device or machine with a particular purpose 小器具；小玩意儿
explanations_and_examples.example: This handy little gadget is for separating egg yolks from whites.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) not easy to use and is often large and heavy 难用的；笨重的
explanations_and_examples.example: The first cellphones were heavy and clumsy to use, but nowadays they are much easier to handle.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) moving or doing things in a careless way, esp. so that you drop things, knock into things, etc. 笨拙的； 不灵活的
explanations_and_examples.example: She was very clumsy and was always walking into doors.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: taking a long time to do 耗费时间的
explanations_and_examples.example: Producing a dictionary is a very time-consuming job.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: weighing only a little or less than average 比通常重量轻的
explanations_and_examples.example: I need a lightweight jacket for the summer evenings.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who has no importance or influence, or who does not have the ability to think deeply — used to show disapproval 微不足道的人，无足轻重的人，思想浅薄的人（含贬义）
explanations_and_examples.example: Brian considered Sam a lightweight, a real amateur.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of a plan or machine) so simple and easy to understand that it is unable to go wrong or be used wrongly （计划或机器）不出问题的，不会误用的， 操作简便的
explanations_and_examples.example: The new speech recognition system is not absolutely foolproof, but it is a huge breakthrough.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: exactly the same, or very similar 完全相同的；极为相似的
explanations_and_examples.example: The picture is identical to the one in The Museum of Modern Art in New York.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not known or familiar 不知道的；不熟悉的
explanations_and_examples.example: Yesterday the village was quite unknown, but today it's on the front page of all the newspapers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the state of not being known or remembered 无名； 默默无闻
explanations_and_examples.example: He was briefly famous in his 40s but after that his life was spent in obscurity and loneliness.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) traveling or occurring in a cycle 兜圈子的；循环的；循环发生的
explanations_and_examples.example: Both sides of the river can be explored on this circular walk.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) shaped like a circle 圆形的；环形的
explanations_and_examples.example: The villa has a circular courtyard with rooms leading off it in all directions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (BrE also popularisation) the act or process of becoming popular or making sth. become well known and liked 普及；推广
explanations_and_examples.example: She wrote a history of the popularization of Chinese food in the US.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also look-alike) very similar in appearance to sb. / sth. else 酷似的
explanations_and_examples.example: The product has been lost in a sea of lookalike competitors.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (fml.) have or own sth. 拥有，持有（某物）
explanations_and_examples.example: Because of his gambling, he lost everything he possessed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (fml.) have a particular quality or ability 拥有， 具有（某品质或能力）
explanations_and_examples.example: I'm afraid he doesn't possess a sense of humor.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: always looking attractive in photographs 上镜的； 上相的
explanations_and_examples.example: The building, old but photogenic, stood among oaks and pines.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] an object that you buy or keep to remind yourself of a special occasion or a place you have visited 纪念品；纪念物
explanations_and_examples.example: He bought a model of a red London bus as a souvenir of his trip to London.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) unfairly supporting one person or one group against another 偏向一方的；偏袒的；不公平的
explanations_and_examples.example: The teacher sometimes seems partial to the cute girls, which makes the boys kind of angry.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) not complete 部分的；不完全的
explanations_and_examples.example: To our disappointment, the exhibition was only a partial success.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not involved in a particular situation, and therefore able to give a fair opinion or piece of advice 不偏不倚的；公正的
explanations_and_examples.example: Historians try to be impartial, but they cannot free themselves entirely from their own opinions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not studying or looking at sth. carefully and only seeing the most noticeable things 肤浅的；浅薄的； 不深入的
explanations_and_examples.example: Unfortunately I only had a very superficial knowledge of music.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sth. continue to exist or happen for a period of time 保持；维持；使持续
explanations_and_examples.example: She found it difficult to catch the children's attention and sustain their interest.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) continuing for a long time 持久的；持续的
explanations_and_examples.example: The government can't maintain conditions for sustained growth if they do not introduce new policies.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction 欣喜； 愉悦
explanations_and_examples.example: To the audience's delight, she agreed to sing two more songs.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] 常春藤
if you soak sth., or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, esp. in order to make it softer or easier to clean 浸；泡
explanations_and_examples.example: The wind had blown the rain in and soaked the carpet.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to emphasize that sb. / sth. does not have a;particular quality or would not do sth. 根本不...；完全不...
explanations_and_examples.example: He's no more fit to be the group leader than I am.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE get round) if news or information gets around, it is told to a lot of people （新闻或消息）传开
explanations_and_examples.example: Word got around that the shopping mall might be closed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: for example 例如
explanations_and_examples.example: We found out that fruit loaf (水果面包) is better than cake or chocolate, for instance.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (infml.) understand the technique of doing sth. 掌握...的窍门
explanations_and_examples.example: It's not difficult once you get the hang of it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: when a vehicle or driver pulls up, the vehicle slows down and stops （车辆或司机）停车
explanations_and_examples.example: The taxi pulled up and the driver jumped out.

children.word: as far as sb. is concerned

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (spoken) used to show what sb.'s opinion on a subject is or how it affects them 就某人而言；在某人看来
explanations_and_examples.example: As far as I am concerned, a change of policy is needed to reduce the unemployment rate.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: wash sth. quickly, esp. the inside of a container 洗净（尤指容器内壁）
explanations_and_examples.example: When the bottle is empty, wash it out thoroughly before refilling.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: after a period of time, or after everything has been done 最后；终于
explanations_and_examples.example: As long as you try hard, you'll surely succeed in the end.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used when describing sb. / sth. in a way that is not quite exact 可以说是
explanations_and_examples.example: Tim became our idol, as it were, the man we all wanted to be.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to talk about the beginning of a situation, or the situation before sth. happened 一开始；起初
explanations_and_examples.example: He didn't remember being given that form; they had probably not even given it to him in the first place.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sth. start moving 让...动起来
explanations_and_examples.example: The wheels of change have been set in motion.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: start to go somewhere 出发；启程
explanations_and_examples.example: What time will we have to set off for Grandma's house tomorrow?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: put a group of things down and arrange them 摆放； 陈列
explanations_and_examples.example: The market traders began setting out their displays.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: escape from a place or situation 逃离（某地）；摆脱（某状况）
explanations_and_examples.example: It's taken a long time to break out of my own conventional training.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: do sth. slowly or carefully without hurrying 从容不迫；不着急
explanations_and_examples.example: There is no need to be so anxious, so let's take our time to get things right.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 哥本哈根（丹麦首都）
丹麦（欧洲国家）
荷兰（欧洲国家）
奥斯陆（挪威首都）
彼得 D. 奥斯本（人名）
柯达（相机品牌）
乔治・伊斯门（美国发明家、柯达公司创办人）
《蒙娜丽莎》（列奥纳多・达・芬奇所绘的肖像画）
卢浮宫（法国博物馆，位于巴黎）
苏珊・桑塔格（美国作家）
乔纳斯・拉森（人名）
罗斯基勒大学（丹麦大学，位于西兰大区）
尼康（相机品牌）
[vi.]fall in drops （液体）滴下，沥下
explanations_and_examples.example: She was hot and sweat dripped into her eyes.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [v.]let liquid fall in drops 滴（水）；滴下（液体）
explanations_and_examples.example: Her boots were muddy and her hair was dripping.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) breathless 使人喘不过气来的
explanations_and_examples.example: She had a car accident and suffered a breathtaking pain.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) very impressive, exciting, or surprising 激动人心的；惊人的；令人惊叹的
explanations_and_examples.example: The view from my bedroom window was absolutely breathtaking.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (BrEfulfilment) the feeling of being happy and satisfied with your life because you are doing interesting, useful, or important things 成就感；充实感
explanations_and_examples.example: Are you looking for greater fulfillment and satisfaction in your work?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very happy, or likely to make people very happy 欢乐的；令人高兴的
explanations_and_examples.example: It was a joyful reunion of all the family.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (fml.) similar and happening at the same time 相似的；同时发生的
explanations_and_examples.example: Social changes in Britain are matched by parallel trends in some other countries.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) two lines, paths, etc. that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length 平行的
explanations_and_examples.example: The railway is parallel with the canal.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) bigger, better, or worse than anything else 无比的；无双的；空前的
explanations_and_examples.example: They enjoyed success on a scale unparalleled by any previous pop group.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) not pleasant and not sensitive to people's feelings伤人的；不顾他人感受的
explanations_and_examples.example: She spoke with brutal honesty — I was too old for the job.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) very cruel and violent 野蛮的；凶残的
explanations_and_examples.example: Jensen is a dangerous man, and can be very brutal and reckless (不顾后果的).

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the quality of being honest 诚实；正直；坦诚
explanations_and_examples.example: She answered all my questions with her usual honesty.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: too unpleasant, painful, or annoying to deal with 难以忍受的；承受不住的；无法容忍的
explanations_and_examples.example: The atmosphere at work at the moment is quite unbearable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: laugh at sb. and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way 戏弄；逗弄；拿...取笑（开玩笑）
explanations_and_examples.example: I used to hate being teased about my red hair when I was at school.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: try to make sb. angry or upset by saying unkind things to them （用语言）挑衅，侮辱，嘲弄，奚落
explanations_and_examples.example: The other children used to taunt him in the playground because he was fat and wore glasses.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) make sb. want to have or do sth., even though they know they really should not 诱惑；引诱；诱使
explanations_and_examples.example: Don't tempt thieves by leaving valuables clearly visible.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) try to persuade sb. to do sth. by making it seem attractive 劝说；鼓励
explanations_and_examples.example: They tempted him to join the company by offering him a large salary and a company car.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: always supporting your friends, principles, country, etc. 忠贞的；忠实的；忠诚的
explanations_and_examples.example: Jack has been a loyal worker in this company for almost 50 years.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (usu. in negatives) stop yourself from having sth. that you like very much or doing sth. that you want to do 忍住；按捺
explanations_and_examples.example: He was unable to resist the temptation to buy the wallet.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C, U] the act of celebrating 庆祝；祝贺；颂扬
explanations_and_examples.example: This was not a memorial service but a celebration of his life.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C] an occasion or party when you celebrate sth. 庆祝会；庆祝活动
explanations_and_examples.example: There were wild street celebrations when England won the Cup.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to say that people or things do sth. or exist together at the same time 与...一起；与...同时
explanations_and_examples.example: Most of the staff refused to work alongside the new team.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: next to the side of sth. 在（...）旁边
explanations_and_examples.example: He crossed the street and walked alongside the park.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the need to take a harmful drug regularly, without being able to stop 瘾；毒瘾
explanations_and_examples.example: He is now fighting his addiction to alcohol.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] a pleasant activity 娱乐；消遣
explanations_and_examples.example: After a long day of work, I found boating a distraction.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C, U] sth. that stops you paying attention to what you are doing 使人分心的事物
explanations_and_examples.example: I study in the library as there are too many distractions at home.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C, U] the colored part of the sky where the sun is appearing in the morning 日出；晨曦；朝霞
explanations_and_examples.example: There was a glorious sunrise over the mountains.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [U] the time when the sun first appears in the morning 日出（时分）；黎明；拂晓
explanations_and_examples.example: They went out at sunrise to go bird-watching.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a polite, kind, and generous way, esp. to people of a lower rank 有礼貌地，仁慈地，和蔼地，亲切地（尤指对较低阶层的人们）
explanations_and_examples.example: Mr. Martel graciously agreed to take time out of his busy schedule to answer some questions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) make sb. lose their physical strength, or becomephysically weak （使）（某人）虚弱（衰弱）
explanations_and_examples.example: Elsa was weakened by her long illness.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) make sb. / sth. less powerful or less important, or become less powerful （使）变弱，削弱，减弱
explanations_and_examples.example: The new evidence weakens the case against her.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a small raised area on a surface 凸起；隆起； 鼓包
explanations_and_examples.example: Her bicycle hit a bump in the road and threw her off.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: hit or knock against sth. 碰；撞
explanations_and_examples.example: Tim was a clumsy boy, always bumping into the furniture.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: show or say that sth. will happen in the future 预示；是...预兆
explanations_and_examples.example: The recent outbreak of violence was foreshadowed by isolated incidents in the city earlier this year.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (on / from the sidelines) not taking part in an activity even though you want to or should do 置身事外；袖手旁观；当旁观者
explanations_and_examples.example: You can't stay on the sidelines for ever; it’s time you got involved.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] an activity that you do as well as your main job or business, in order to earn more money 副业； 兼职
explanations_and_examples.example: Jim works in a bank, but teaches French in the evenings as a sideline.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: always, or for a very long time 永久地；长久地
explanations_and_examples.example: Michael and his family have settled permanently in the States.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (always + ad. / prep.) move back and away from sth., esp. because you are frightened （尤因恐惧而） 退缩，畏缩
explanations_and_examples.example: His anger was enough to make the others shrink away from him.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: become smaller, or make sth. smaller, through the effects of heat or water （使）缩小；（使）收缩
explanations_and_examples.example: Your sweater will shrink if you wash it at too high a temperature.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: try to deal with a difficult problem 处理，对付（难题）
explanations_and_examples.example: There is more than one way to tackle the problem.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the possibility that sth. will happen 可能性；希望
explanations_and_examples.example: There is every prospect of the weather remaining dry this week.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a bend in a road, river, etc. （道路、河流等的）弯曲处
explanations_and_examples.example: As he rounded the curve he saw her standing by the gate.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a line that gradually bends like part of a circle 曲线；弧线
explanations_and_examples.example: The seats were arranged to form a curve.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) one of a series of small fences that a person or horse has to jump over during a race （跨栏赛跑或马术比赛中用的）栏架
explanations_and_examples.example: She cleared all the hurdles easily and raced to the finishing line.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a problem or difficulty that you must deal with before you can achieve sth. 障碍；困难
explanations_and_examples.example: Finding enough money for the project was the first hurdle.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (infml.) the end of a marriage or relationship — used esp. in newspapers and magazines 离婚，分手（尤作报刊用语）
explanations_and_examples.example: She seems to be getting over her recent split with her fiancé .

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (split, split) divide, or make a group of people divide, into smaller groups that have very different opinions （组织内部）产生分歧，分裂
explanations_and_examples.example: The party is split over the issue of immigration.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: break or make sth. break, either so that it gets lines on its surface, or so that it breaks into pieces （使）破裂；（使）裂开
explanations_and_examples.example: Due to her carelessness, she fell and cracked a bone in her leg.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having one or more lines on the surface because it is damaged but not completely broken 有裂缝的； 有裂痕的
explanations_and_examples.example: She passed her tongue over her cracked lips and tried to speak.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: take a long walk in the mountains or countryside （在...）徒步旅行，远足
explanations_and_examples.example: His dream is to hike the world's highest mountain.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a long walk in the mountains or countryside （在山区或乡间的）徒步旅行，远足
explanations_and_examples.example: We went for a hike through the woods on Sunday.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] 植物学
[U] the state of being kept safe, or the action of keeping sth. safe 安全保管 ; 妥善保管
explanations_and_examples.example: My passport was in the inner pocket of my bag, for safekeeping.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a person who is very interested in a particular hobby 爱好者
explanations_and_examples.example: The computer hobbyists are going to love this project.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 松针；松叶
make cloth, a carpet, a basket, etc. by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom 编；织
explanations_and_examples.example: This type of wool is woven into fabric which will make jackets.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if two things merge, or if one thing merges into another, you cannot clearly see them, hear them, etc. as separate things 相融；融入；渐渐消失在另一物中
explanations_and_examples.example: The hills merged into the dark sky behind them.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: combine, or join things together to form one thing 合并；融合
explanations_and_examples.example: The banks are set to merge next year.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not able to be identified as different or distinct 难以分辨的；难以区分的
explanations_and_examples.example: The male of the species is almost indistinguishable from the female.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the rate at which goods are produced, and theamount produced, esp. in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them 生产率；生产效率；生产量；生产力
explanations_and_examples.example: Studies show that if a working environment is pleasant, productivity increases.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) the state of being weak or uncertain, and likely to become worse under pressure （形式）脆弱，不稳定
explanations_and_examples.example: The collapse of the bank is an reminder of the fragility of the world’s banking system.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) the state of being easily broken or damaged 脆弱；易碎；易损坏
explanations_and_examples.example: A deficiency of copper (缺铜) can cause increased bone fragility.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) easy to obtain or use 易得到的；易使用的
explanations_and_examples.example: I had to keep the video camera readily accessible in case I saw something that needed to be filmed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) easy to reach or get into 易到达的；易进入的
explanations_and_examples.example: The remote desert area is only accessible by helicopter (直升机).

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization 大型公司；企业集团
explanations_and_examples.example: She didn't want to work for a big corporation where everything was so impersonal.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) available to be used 可以使用的
explanations_and_examples.example: The nation's disposable earnings amounted to 586 billion dollars.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) intended to be used once or for a short time and then thrown away 一次性的 ; 用完即弃的
explanations_and_examples.example: She joined Kiley at the counter, holding a disposable cup with coffee in it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 游乐场
1) start to exist; appear or become known 兴起；开始被人所知
explanations_and_examples.example: The state emerges as a leader in the field of next-generation energy.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) appear or come out from somewhere 出现；浮现
explanations_and_examples.example: The doors opened and people began to emerge into the street.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people 特权；特殊待遇
explanations_and_examples.example: Senior management enjoys certain privileges, such as company cars and private healthcare.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (the ~) [pl.] people who have a lot of money, possessions, etc. 有钱人；富人
explanations_and_examples.example: The best education should not be available only to the wealthy.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) having a lot of money, possessions, etc. 富有的；有钱的
explanations_and_examples.example: He left as a poor, working class boy and returned as an extremely wealthy man.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of a device or process) working by itself with little or no direct human control （装置或流程）自动的
explanations_and_examples.example: The door we escaped through had an automatic lock but we didn't know that.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a political situation in which people protest or behave violently 动荡；动乱；骚动
explanations_and_examples.example: Due to the economic downturn, there's growing social unrest in the country.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a situation in which there is not enough of sth. that people need 短缺；不足；缺乏
explanations_and_examples.example: The long hot summer has led to serious water shortages.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity, etc. in a country than usual （经济）衰退， 萧条
explanations_and_examples.example: We should concentrate on sharply reducing interest rates to pull the economy out of recession.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: unhappy or not satisfied with the situation you are in 不满的；不满足的；不愉快的
explanations_and_examples.example: He felt discontented with the way his life had turned out.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: giving pleasure 令人愉快的；令人快乐的
explanations_and_examples.example: We spent an enjoyable evening talking about old times.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: certain to happen and impossible to avoid 必然发生的；不可避免的
explanations_and_examples.example: It was an inevitable consequence of the decision.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: consider that two things are similar or connected 使等同；同等看待
explanations_and_examples.example: I'm always wary (小心翼翼的) of men wearing suits, as I equate this with power and authority.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) having two of sth. or two parts 双的；双重的；两部分的
explanations_and_examples.example: The piece of furniture serves a dual purpose as a cupboard and as a table.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (fml.) the state of having two of sth. or two parts 双重性
explanations_and_examples.example: His poems reveal the duality of his nature, the joy and hope, the fear and despair.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having a strong belief that everything can be perfect, often in a way that does not seem to be realistic or practical 乌托邦的；空想完美主义的
explanations_and_examples.example: He was pursuing a utopian dream of world prosperity.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (mainly AmE, infml.) a piece of work or a job that you get paid for doing in addition to doing your main job 副业
explanations_and_examples.example: Even if you love your job and find your work fulfilling, you can still benefit from a side hustle.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) concerning sb. / sth.; about sb. / sth. 关于
explanations_and_examples.example: Regarding your recent inquiry, I have sent you a copy of our new brochure.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) the point at which one feeling, idea, quality, etc. stops and another starts （不同情感、思想、品质等之间的）分野，分界线
explanations_and_examples.example: The boundaries between history and storytelling are always being blurred.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country, etc., or the edge of an area of land that belongs to sb. 分界线；边界
explanations_and_examples.example: The Mississippi River forms a natural boundary between Iowa and Illinois.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (for the ~ of sb. / sth., for sb.'s / sth.'s ~) in order to help, improve, or please sb. / sth. 为了某人/某事的缘故
explanations_and_examples.example: Their parents only stayed together for the sake of the children.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) relating to the practice of emptying your mind of thoughts and feelings, in order to relax completely or for religious reasons 冥想的；默想的
explanations_and_examples.example: She closed her eyes and went into a meditative state.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) thinking deeply and seriously about sth.; involving deep thought 深思的；沉思的；思考的
explanations_and_examples.example: When he entered the room, she was in a meditative mood.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (BrE paycheque) (esp. AmE) the amount of wages sb. earns 薪金；工资
explanations_and_examples.example: The new bill could mean a larger paycheck for state employees.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: spoil or destroy sth. completely 毁坏；毁掉；糟蹋
explanations_and_examples.example: Huge modern hotels have ruined this once undisturbed coastline.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the quality or state of being pure 纯；纯洁；洁净；纯正；纯粹
explanations_and_examples.example: The color white is the color of purity and that is why women typically wear white when they get married.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: improve sth. 改善；改进
explanations_and_examples.example: The measures taken should considerably enhance the residents' quality of life.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if you do sth. by choice, you do it because you want to do it and not because you are forced to do it 自己选择的；自愿的
explanations_and_examples.example: She repeated that she was very comfortable and lived here by choice.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: for only sb. to have or use; not shared 独有；专用
explanations_and_examples.example: I'm going out, so you’ll have the place to yourself.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) use all of sth. and not have any more left 用完， 耗尽（某物）
explanations_and_examples.example: Few of us would know what to do if the supermarkets ran out of food.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (of a supply of sth.) be used up （供应品）被用完， 被耗尽
explanations_and_examples.example: We must act now because time is running out.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also be sick to death of) (spoken) be angry or bored with sth. that has been happening for a long time 对某事感到气愤（厌倦）
explanations_and_examples.example: She has had the same job for years and is heartily sick of it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: treat sb. badly when you are angry or upset, even though it is not their fault 向（某人）发泄（不满等）； 拿（某人）出气
explanations_and_examples.example: When he's under pressure at work, he takes it out on me.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (infml.) a problem that arises and interferes with forward progress (usu. only temporarily) 前进中的问题（通常是暂时的）
explanations_and_examples.example: The project hit a bump in the road when Tom suddenly resigned.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: start doing or discussing sth. new 开始做（别的事）； 换话题
explanations_and_examples.example: When you finish, move on to the next exercise.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: be able to do what you need to do, earn your own money, etc. without help from others 自立；独立自主
explanations_and_examples.example: Jack's never learned to stand on his own two feet.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: essentially or innately 生性
explanations_and_examples.example: She was by nature a very sensitive person.

children.word: have a hard time doing sth.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: be difficult for sb. to do sth. 做某事很难
explanations_and_examples.example: I had a hard time persuading him to accept the offer.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: cause sb. to do sth. 导致某人做某事
explanations_and_examples.example: What led him to reconsider his position?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: depend on sb. to provide help, advice, etc. 指望；依靠
explanations_and_examples.example: They're looking to the new manager to make the company profitable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: have an important effect or influence on sb. / sth 有作用；有影响
explanations_and_examples.example: Where you live can make such a difference to the way you feel.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 埃里克・巴尔诺 ( 美国广播电视史学家、作家 )
[C] (BrE also generalisation) a statement about all the members of a group that may be true in some or many situations but is not true in every case （片面的）概括，泛论
explanations_and_examples.example: You can't make generalizations about what men and women are like.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] an idea or story that many people believe, but which is not true （许多人相信的）错误观念 , 荒诞说法
explanations_and_examples.example: Contrary to popular myth, women are not worse drivers than men.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (fml.) a husband or wife 配偶
explanations_and_examples.example: Please notice that spouses are welcome to the company picnic.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) (only before noun) connected with a husband or wife; of or from a husband or wife 配偶的
explanations_and_examples.example: Here are the 10 things you should never say in a spousal argument.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: feeling annoyed and impatient because you cannot do or achieve what you want 懊丧的；懊恼的；沮丧的
explanations_and_examples.example: Stacy got so frustrated that she stood up and walked out of the room.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the state of being logical and true 符合逻辑；正当；正确
explanations_and_examples.example: We had serious doubts about the validity of their argument.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ from) develop as a result of sth. else 源于；来自；由...引起
explanations_and_examples.example: Part of the education problem stems from the fact that class sizes have increased dramatically in the last five years.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C]（植物的）茎，梗，柄
go around searching for food or other supplies （为找到食物、补给等）四处搜寻
explanations_and_examples.example: When it's cold and snowy outside, birds may forage for food in your backyard.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (pl. millennia) a period of 1,000 years 一千年；千年期
explanations_and_examples.example: The year 2000 was celebrated as the beginning of the third millennium.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: based on instinct, not thought or training 本能的；直觉的；天性的
explanations_and_examples.example: Animals provide the best examples of instinctive behavior.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (fml.) a particular way or style of behaving, living, or doing sth. 方式；方法；做法
explanations_and_examples.example: Many children recognize that cycling and walking are environmentally-friendly modes of transportation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth 营养（作用）；滋养
explanations_and_examples.example: It is widely known that nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of food) containing many of the substances which help the body to grow （食物）有营养的，营养丰富的
explanations_and_examples.example: The cookbook contains many simple yet highly nutritious meals.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: fit or suitable to be eaten; not poisonous 适宜食用 的；（无毒而）可以吃的
explanations_and_examples.example: There are many edible fruits growing wild in the coastal forest.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: get rid of sth. 扔掉；弃置
explanations_and_examples.example: Would you help me remove the seeds from the melon and discard them?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: heavily loaded with sth. 载满的；装满的
explanations_and_examples.example: He was surprised to find that the tables were laden with food.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U, sing.] the traditional beliefs, values, customs, etc. of a family, country, or society （文化）遗产；传统
explanations_and_examples.example: These works of art are of great importance to Russia's national heritage.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: relating to the time in history before anything was written down 史前的；有历史记载以前的
explanations_and_examples.example: We do not have to go back to prehistoric times to witness the change in our diet.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] sth. that you buy or obtain, often to add to things that you already have 购置物；获得物
explanations_and_examples.example: The Art Society is holding an exhibition of recent acquisitions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [U] the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill （知识、技能的）获得，习得
explanations_and_examples.example: We need to recognize that second language acquisition is a gradual developmental process.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of the air or climate) warm and damp （空气或气候）温暖潮湿的，湿热的
explanations_and_examples.example: It was a hot, humid day, and the only sound was the buzzing of insects.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (fml.) a particular quality in sb.'s character （某人性格中的）特性，品质
explanations_and_examples.example: It's a human trait to joke about subjects that make us uncomfortable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] an inclination toward a particular characteristic or type of behavior 趋势；趋向；倾向
explanations_and_examples.example: For students, there is a tendency to socialize in the evenings.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a person who studies anthropology 人类学家
explanations_and_examples.example: Anthropologists study the origin, development, and functioning of human societies and cultures.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the state of being almost the same, or a particular way in which sth. is almost the same 相似性；类似性；相似处；相似点
explanations_and_examples.example: The police are checking for similarities with other recent attacks in the area.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a member of your family who lived a long time ago 祖先；祖宗
explanations_and_examples.example: Although I'm British myself, my ancestors were actually French.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: of, relating to, or inherited from an ancestor 祖先的
explanations_and_examples.example: The house is the ancestral home of Baron Stourton, but after the family moved out in the 1960s it fell into disrepair.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (be ~ to do sth.; be ~ to sth.) be likely to do sth. or behave in a particular way 有做某事的意向；倾向于做某事
explanations_and_examples.example: They'll be more inclined to listen carefully if you don't shout.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) long or longer than usual or expected 较长时间的；延期的
explanations_and_examples.example: If you are going abroad for an extended period of time, you should consider renting your house out.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) based on experiments or experience rather than ideas or theories 以实验（经验）为依据的；经验主义的
explanations_and_examples.example: There is strong empirical evidence to suggest that these concerns are not trivial.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a good reason why sth. exists or is done 正当理由
explanations_and_examples.example: I can see no possible justification for any further tax increases.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: have qualities, physical features, etc. that are similar to those of your parents, grandparents, etc. 经遗传获得（品质、身体特征等）
explanations_and_examples.example: Mr. Grass inherited his work ethic from his father.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: receive money, property, etc. from sb. when they die 继承（金钱、财产等）
explanations_and_examples.example: He inherited a large sum of money from his grandmother about 10 years ago.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment 明智的；合理的；实际的；有判断力的
explanations_and_examples.example: People are far more sensible about what and how much they drink these days.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like 模式化的思想；老一套；旧框框
explanations_and_examples.example: Current evidence indicates that older people are more healthy than popular stereotypes suggest.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the fact of being important and well-known 重要；杰出；著名
explanations_and_examples.example: His rise to prominence would not have been possible without the war.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [U] feelings of pity, love, sadness, etc. that are often considered to be too strong or not suitable for a particular situation 多愁善感；感情因素
explanations_and_examples.example: He was overwhelmed by sentiment as he thought of his wife.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C, U] (fml.) an opinion or feeling you have about sth. 意见；观点；感想
explanations_and_examples.example: Public sentiment is against any change to the law.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having the qualities or appearance considered to be typical of women; connected with women （指气质或外貌）女性特有的；女性的
explanations_and_examples.example: Amelia's report describes the experience from a feminine point of view.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: connected with literature 文学的；文学上的
explanations_and_examples.example: In a literary essay, you should explore the meaning and construction of the text.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having feelings that are typical of a caring mother toward a child 母性的；母亲般慈爱的
explanations_and_examples.example: She seems to have a strong maternal instinct.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: to a much greater level or degree than seems reasonable or appropriate 过度地；过多地
explanations_and_examples.example: The country relies excessively on borrowing from abroad.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the fact of being male or female 性别
explanations_and_examples.example: It is a country where gender roles have remained largely unchanged.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the unfair difference between groups of people in society, when some have more wealth, status, or opportunities than others 不平等；不平衡；不平均
explanations_and_examples.example: There has been an increase in economic inequality between different areas of the country.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U, sing.] an unfair personal opinion that influences your judgment 偏见；成见；偏心
explanations_and_examples.example: It's clear that the company has a bias against women.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the act of printing a book, a magazine, etc. and making it available to the public; a book, a magazine, etc. that has been published （书刊等的）出版，发行；出版物
explanations_and_examples.example: That professor was the author of 70 major scientific publications.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE analyse) examine or think about sth. carefully, in order to understand it 分析；剖析
explanations_and_examples.example: We use a special computer program to analyze all the sales figures.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: recognize and correctly name sb. / sth. 认出，识别（某人或某物）
explanations_and_examples.example: Passengers were asked to identify their own suitcases before they were put on the plane.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a statement, letter, etc. that shows that sth. is true, correct, or definite 证实；证明
explanations_and_examples.example: I'm still waiting for confirmation of the test results.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: acting or happening in a way that is expected 可预料的；可预见的
explanations_and_examples.example: In March and April, the weather in this area is much less predictable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very unusual or surprising 异乎寻常的；令人惊奇的
explanations_and_examples.example: There has been a startling increase in the number of homeless people.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having a quality or characteristic that makes sth. different and easily noticed 特有的；特别的；有特色的
explanations_and_examples.example: Whatever you think of Larkin's poetry, it's certainly distinctive.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a magazine, esp. one about a serious or technical subject 期刊
explanations_and_examples.example: Readers will find a complete list of periodicals dealing with that subject.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) done in a planned and determined way, esp. by more than one person, government, country, etc. 齐心协力的；一致的
explanations_and_examples.example: Libraries have made a concerted effort to attract young people.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a serious speech or piece of writing on a particular subject （关于某主题的）演讲，论述，著述
explanations_and_examples.example: He was hoping for some lively political discourse at the meeting.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) relating to amounts rather than to the quality or standard of sth. （数）量的；与数量有关的；定量的
explanations_and_examples.example: We need to do a proper quantitative analysis of this problem.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the fact of having sb. to speak, vote, or make decisions for you 代理；代表
explanations_and_examples.example: Minority groups need more effective parliamentary representation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not serious, important, or valuable 微不足道的；没有什么价值的
explanations_and_examples.example: I know it sounds trivial, but I'm worried about it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: easy to see or notice; clear or definite 显著的；显而易见的
explanations_and_examples.example: Road noise tends to be more noticeable in certain weather conditions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) hide sth. or change it, so that it cannot be recognized 掩蔽；掩饰
