explanations_and_examples.example: The speech was seen by many as a thinly disguised attack on the president.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) change sb.'s appearance so that people cannot recognize them 装扮；假扮
explanations_and_examples.example: He disguised himself by wearing a false beard.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (of feelings, thoughts, etc.) existing or happening without you realizing or being aware; not deliberate or controlled （感情、思想等）无意识的，未意识到的
explanations_and_examples.example: He seems to be driven by an unconscious desire to do better than everyone else.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) unable to see, move, feel, etc. in the normal way because you are not conscious 不省人事的；失去知觉的
explanations_and_examples.example: They found him lying unconscious on the floor.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a person or company whose business is to arrange the writing, production, and sale of books, newspapers, etc. （书、报纸等的）出版者，出版商；出版社
explanations_and_examples.example: The publisher planned to produce the journal on a weekly basis.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: continue doing an activity or trying to achieve sth. over a long period of time 追求；继续进行
explanations_and_examples.example: Students should pursue their own interests, as well as do their school work.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way 歧视
explanations_and_examples.example: Laws have got to be tougher to stop discrimination against the disabled.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: lasting for a long time 持久的；耐久的
explanations_and_examples.example: One of my most enduring memories is of going on holiday to France with my parents.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: have an effect on or concern a particular person, group, or situation 适用于；对...有效
explanations_and_examples.example: The offer only applies to flights from London and Manchester.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: whatever is needed to achieve sth. 不惜一切代价
explanations_and_examples.example: I have to avoid being late for work again at all costs, or I'll lose my job.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE, spoken) immediately or without delay 立刻；马上
explanations_and_examples.example: I wrote him a letter and posted it straight away.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also in … terms) used to show what aspects of a subject you are talking about or how you are thinking about it 谈及；就...而言；在...方面；从...方面来说
explanations_and_examples.example: It's a mistake to think of Florida only in terms of its tourist attractions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also in respect of) (fml.) concerning or in relation to sth. 关于...；就...而言
explanations_and_examples.example: The two groups were similar with respect to income and status.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: similar to, or at the same level as sth. 与...相似；与...水平一致
explanations_and_examples.example: The new policy is in line with the plans that were discussed last year.

children.word: rise to prominence / fame / power, etc.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: become important, famous, powerful, etc. 变得更加杰出、著名、强大等
explanations_and_examples.example: She played an important supporting role in family as her husband rose to fame as an actor.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: at issue or in question 待解决的；成问题的
explanations_and_examples.example: His own personal future was at stake.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (before common era) 公元前
中东（一般泛指欧、亚、非三洲连接的地区）
克鲁格（人名）
拜克（人名）
简・奥斯汀（英国小说家）
(George Henry Lewes)乔治・亨利・刘易斯（英国哲学家、文学评论家和剧作家）
乔治・艾略特（英国小说家）
make sb. feel better when they are feeling sad or disappointed 安慰；慰藉
explanations_and_examples.example: He consoled himself that he would see Kate again soon.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) become mentally or emotionally strong again after a bad experience, or help sb. to do this （在精神或感情上）（使）复原，（使）坚强起来
explanations_and_examples.example: Bianca was the kind of woman who could heal his soul, if he had time to let her.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (also heal up) become healthy again; make sth. healthy again （使）康复，复原
explanations_and_examples.example: It took a long time for the wounds to heal.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] when two things happen at the same time, in the same place, or to the same people in a way that seems surprising or unusual 巧合；巧事
explanations_and_examples.example: I think it is more than coincidence that all the complaints have come from the same group of people.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a treatment that helps sb. feel better, grow stronger, etc., esp. after an illness 治疗；疗法
explanations_and_examples.example: Many patients receiving these new therapies respond rapidly to them and get a lot of clinical benefit.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) suggest sth. as a plan or course of action 提议； 建议
explanations_and_examples.example: In his speech he proposed that the UN should set up an emergency center for the environment.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (usu. before noun) lasting for only a short time 短暂的；飞逝的
explanations_and_examples.example: For one fleeting moment, Paula allowed herself to forget her troubles.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the act of betraying sb. / sth. or the fact of being betrayed 背叛；出卖
explanations_and_examples.example: She wondered if he felt hurt at his best friend's betrayal but didn't have the courage to ask.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: continue to exist for a long time 持续
explanations_and_examples.example: He wasn't the only one who doubted the relationship would endure.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining 忍耐；忍受
explanations_and_examples.example: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] when you are with sb. you enjoy being with, and are not alone 友谊；友好交往
explanations_and_examples.example: That feeling of companionship can make a huge difference, especially at a stressful job.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a sudden clear understanding of sth. or part of sth., esp. a complicated situation or idea （尤指对复杂情况、看法的）顿悟，猛醒
explanations_and_examples.example: The article gives us a real insight into the causes of the present economic crisis.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 叙述者；讲述者
[C] (AmE also monolog) a long speech by one person 长篇独白
explanations_and_examples.example: Blogs are not just about one person sharing in a monologue with everyone else listening.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that is surprising because it is the opposite of what you would expect 自相矛盾地；反常地
explanations_and_examples.example: Paradoxically, the economy is improving although many families complain about the poverty in which they live.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) belonging to mental or spiritual life 内心的；精神的
explanations_and_examples.example: Interior monolog is defined as the thoughts you have running through your brain or the things that you silently tell yourself.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. sing.] the inner part or inside of sth. 内部；里面
explanations_and_examples.example: The interior of the church was dark.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: true or suitable in very situation 普遍正确的；广泛适用的
explanations_and_examples.example: It is an almost universal truth that the more weare promoted in a job, the less we exercise the skills we initially used to perform it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the quality or state of being true or suitable in every situation 普遍性；通用性
explanations_and_examples.example: His lyrics aim for a certain timeless universality.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the quality of not changing as the years go past, or as fashion changes 永恒；不朽
explanations_and_examples.example: It is said that all diamonds are symbolic of love, commitment, and timelessness, but adding yellow to the stone gives it even deeper meaning.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: existing in the mind but not immediately available to consciousness 下意识的；潜意识的
explanations_and_examples.example: There are conscious thoughts that you're aware of and subconscious ones that you're not.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make or become less severe, difficult, unpleasant, painful, etc. 缓解；减轻
explanations_and_examples.example: The school needs to take some measures to ease the burden on busy teachers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the fact that sth. is easy to do 容易；轻易；不费劲
explanations_and_examples.example: He studied hard every day so that he could pass the exam with ease.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also empathic) having the ability to understand sb. else's feelings or emotions 同情的；共鸣的
explanations_and_examples.example: Providing a loving home environment can help the child to become independent, self-confident, and empathetic toward others.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a mild illness or health problem is not serious 不严重的；轻微的
explanations_and_examples.example: She had a mild headache, and went to bed much earlier than usual.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) not very strong or hot-tasting 不浓烈的；淡的；不辣的
explanations_and_examples.example: I like this kind of cheese because it has a pleasant mild flavor.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sth. wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness 症状
explanations_and_examples.example: Tiredness is one of the most common symptoms of stress.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 阅读治疗专家
1) in a way that happens repeatedly 多次重复地；频繁地
explanations_and_examples.example: We are continually reassessing the situation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) in a way that continues for a long time without stopping 持续地；不间断地
explanations_and_examples.example: The telephone has been ringing continually in the office all morning.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: feel extremely sad, esp. because sb. you love has died （尤指因所爱之人去世而）感到悲痛
explanations_and_examples.example: He died, and every day since then I have grieved for him.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the events that form the main story of a book, film, or play （书、电影、戏剧的）情节
explanations_and_examples.example: Although the cast (全体演员) was different back then, the plot was strikingly similar.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: fictional people, events, etc. are imaginary and from a book or story 虚构的；编造的；小说（中）的
explanations_and_examples.example: He has created many lively fictional characters with his wonderful writing.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] when you stop working, usu. because of your age 退休；退职
explanations_and_examples.example: He became a keen golfer after his retirement from politics.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) continuing only for a short time 短暂的；转瞬即逝的；一时的
explanations_and_examples.example: The trading data show that these events had minimal and transient effect on the price of gold and silver.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the state of continuing only for a short time 短暂；转瞬即逝
explanations_and_examples.example: History is a combination of permanence and transience.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (of a situation) complicated and unpleasant to deal with （状况）棘手的
explanations_and_examples.example: If you find yourself in a messy situation, please take these five strategies to heart.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) dirty or untidy 脏的；乱的
explanations_and_examples.example: Sorry, the place is so messy because I haven't had time to clear up.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] extreme sadness, esp. because sb. you love has died 悲痛，极度悲伤（尤指因所爱之人去世）
explanations_and_examples.example: The grief she felt over Helen's death was almost unbearable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a feeling that you have no hope at all 绝望
explanations_and_examples.example: A few positive words can turn despair into hope.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (fml.) a short piece of writing about a person or place that you knew well, or an event that you experienced 传略；实录
explanations_and_examples.example: His memoir of his friend Professor Fleeming Jenkin was published soon after his departure.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (~s) [pl.] a book by sb. important and famous in which they write about their life and experiences （名人）回忆录
explanations_and_examples.example: Angelou's first volume of memoirs dealt with her childhood.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [U] (fml.) the act, process, or skill of telling a story 叙述；叙述技巧
explanations_and_examples.example: The novel contains too much dialog and not enough narrative.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C] (fml.) a description of events in a story, esp. in a novel （尤指小说中的）叙述，记叙
explanations_and_examples.example: At several points in the narrative the two stories cross.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: believing that good things will happen in the future 乐观的；乐观主义的
explanations_and_examples.example: Bankers are cautiously optimistic about the country's economic future.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: undergo a change in appearance, form, or character 改观；变形；转化
explanations_and_examples.example: The trip to the cinema transforms into a full-day activity for the family.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: completely change the appearance, form, or character of sb. / sth., esp. in a way that improves it 使改观；使变形；使转化
explanations_and_examples.example: The movie transformed her almost overnight from an unknown schoolgirl into a star.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) greatly loved or treasured by sb. 珍爱的；心爱的
explanations_and_examples.example: Look after my daughter — she's very precious to me.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) valuable and important and not to be wasted or used without care 宝贵的
explanations_and_examples.example: Books were very scarce and very precious in this village, and only a few men could read them.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (~ of discovery) a situation in which you learn a lot of new things about sb. / sth. （对某人或某事有大量新发现的）发现之旅
explanations_and_examples.example: Writing a biography is an absorbing voyage of discovery.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a long journey in a ship or spacecraft （乘船或宇宙飞船的长途）航行
explanations_and_examples.example: The voyage from England to India used to take six months.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) the copies of a book, newspaper, etc. that are produced and printed at the same time 版次
explanations_and_examples.example: The textbook was first published in 1858 and is now in its 39th edition.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) the form that a book, newspaper, magazine, etc. is produced in 版本
explanations_and_examples.example: The regional editions of the paper contain specific information for that area.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 连字符；连（字）号
[C] （墙上的）鸽笼式分类架，信件格，文件格
(also henceforward) (fml.) from this time on 从今以后；今后；从现在起
explanations_and_examples.example: All financial and economical questions were henceforth to be decided by a majority of votes.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 大肚子
be disloyal to sb. who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset 背叛（信任你的人）；对...不忠；出卖
explanations_and_examples.example: But don't you think you betray him by not giving him a chance?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: so wrong or bad that cannot be allowed 不能接受的
explanations_and_examples.example: The recommendations from this report are unacceptable to many black people.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 毫秒；千分之一秒
hit sb. / sth. quickly and lightly 轻敲；轻拍；轻叩
explanations_and_examples.example: Tap the X or Z key to scroll (滚动) to the right or to the left.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (esp. BrE) （水、煤气等管道或容器的）龙头， 阀门
[C] (esp. BrE) 发送（手机） 短信息的 人
[U] the marks used to divide a piece of writing into sentences, phrases, etc. 标点符号（总称）
attack or treat brutally 攻击；残害
explanations_and_examples.example: The animal then turned on him and he was savaged.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very violent or cruel 凶猛的；残暴的
explanations_and_examples.example: This was a savage attack on a defenseless young girl.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: damage or destroy sth. by using it in an unsuitable way 蹂躏；破坏
explanations_and_examples.example: Is the idea that texting is raping our vocabulary exaggerated?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 箭筒；箭囊；箭袋
shake slightly because you are cold, or because you feel very afraid, angry, excited, etc. 颤抖；发抖
explanations_and_examples.example: Her lips quivered and then she started to cry.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] unkind laughter or remarks that are intended to make sb. / sth. seem stupid 嘲笑；奚落
explanations_and_examples.example: He had become an object of ridicule among the other students.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: annoying 使人恼火的
explanations_and_examples.example: He's the most irritating man I've ever met.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also chatter away / on) talk quickly in a friendly way without stopping, esp. about things that are not serious or important 唠叨；喋喋不休
explanations_and_examples.example: She chattered away happily until she noticed I wasn't listening.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 微笑符（电子邮件中使用的表示愉快的符号，如 :-)）
[C] （在电子邮件和因特网上使用的）表情符号
[C] 冒号
[C] 破折号
go or run somewhere very quickly 猛冲；疾奔
explanations_and_examples.example: She dashed into the room, grabbed her bag, and ran out again.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. pl.] (AmE parenthesis) 圆括弧；圆括号
explanations_and_examples.example: Last year's sales figures are given in brackets.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: a short form of a word or expression 缩略语；缩写
explanations_and_examples.example: We will use this abbreviation in this article and throughout the series.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very rude or insulting and likely to upset people 无理的；冒犯的；令人恼火的
explanations_and_examples.example: The program contains language which some viewers may find offensive.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: unlikely to offend or upset anyone 不冒犯人的；不会得罪人的
explanations_and_examples.example: Her husband was a small, inoffensive-looking man.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: more and more all the time 不断增加地；越来越多地
explanations_and_examples.example: Increasingly, businesses are having to reduce their cost in order to survive.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) difficult to understand 费解的；晦涩的
explanations_and_examples.example: For some obscure reason, the group is very popular.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) not well known and usu. not very important 无名的；默默无闻的；鲜为人知的
explanations_and_examples.example: He was born around 1650 but his origins remain obscure.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (fml.) sb. who receives sth. 接受者；领受者
explanations_and_examples.example: I felt glad that I was a giver of pleasure, not merely a passive recipient.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: the state of being unclear, confusing, or not certain, or things that produce this effect 模棱两可；不明确（的事物）
explanations_and_examples.example: There was an element of ambiguity in the president's reply.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a rule, problem, etc. that prevents people from doing sth., or limits what they can do 障碍；壁垒
explanations_and_examples.example: Problems with childcare remain the biggest barrier to women succeeding at work.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (in my ~ opinion) used humorously to give your opinion about sth. 愚以为，依拙见（幽默用法）
explanations_and_examples.example: There is no greater mass-produced, affordable safety device around in my humble opinion.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people's 谦虚的；谦卑的

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] sth. that you complain about 投诉的事；不满的事

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C, U] a statement in which sb. complains about sth. 投诉

explanations_and_examples.explanation: a complete change in ways of thinking, methods of working, etc. （思想、工作方式等的）彻底变革，革命
explanations_and_examples.example: In the last 10 years there has been a revolution in education.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (the ~) [sing.] the world 地球；世界

explanations_and_examples.explanation: able to change in order to be successful in new and different situations 能适应的；适应性强的

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] 网络语言
very silly or unreasonable 愚蠢的；荒唐的；可笑的

explanations_and_examples.explanation: changing all the time 不断变化的

explanations_and_examples.explanation: have a bad effect on sth. so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful, etc. 毁掉；糟蹋；破坏

explanations_and_examples.explanation: because you want sth. to happen 抱着...的希望

explanations_and_examples.explanation: turn the pages of a book quickly, without reading it properly 匆匆翻阅
explanations_and_examples.example: I picked up the magazine and leafed through it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if your eyes fall on sth., or your gaze, glance falls on sth., you notice it （某人的目光）落在某物上

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (written) be badly affected or destroyed by sth. 受到...的损害

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not any more 不再

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (infml.) a request or piece of work that is almost impossible 很难实现的要求，奢求；很难完成的工作

explanations_and_examples.explanation: deal with sth. or do sth. for sb. 照料；处理

cook under or over direct heat 烤；烧；焙

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make (bread, cheese, etc.) brown by placing it close to heat 烤，烘（面包、奶酪等）

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] (pl. tuna or tunas) 金枪鱼（肉）

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] 蛋黄酱

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [sing.] the disadvantage or negative aspect of sth. 不利方面

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not deliberate 无意的；无心的

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (~s) [pl.] food left after a meal 残羹剩饭

explanations_and_examples.explanation: of the color of gold 金色的

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] 蛋黄

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very great 巨大的；重大的

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having a great influence or effect 影响深远的

explanations_and_examples.example: Watching the sun rise over the mountain was an almost mystical experience.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: connected with the chemistry of living things 生物化学的
explanations_and_examples.example: People can become addicted to the biochemical changes brought about by heavy exercise.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (usu. before noun) using measurements of human features, such as fingers or eyes, in order to identify people 生物特征识别的
explanations_and_examples.example: The major biometric methods include face, voice, and fingerprint recognition.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) guess sth. using as many facts as you can find 预测；估计
explanations_and_examples.example: Researchers calculated that this group was at a higher risk of heart disease.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) find out how much sth. will cost, how long sth. will take, etc., by using numbers 计算；核算
explanations_and_examples.example: You should calculate how much time this assignment will take before you start doing it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a careful examination of sth. in order to understand it better （对事物的）分析
explanations_and_examples.example: At the meeting, they presented a detailed analysis of 12 schools in London.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) the information produced by a computer （计算机的）输出信息
explanations_and_examples.example: You run the software, you look at the output, and then you make modifications (修改).

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory, etc. 产量；产品
explanations_and_examples.example: Government statistics show the largest drop in industrial output for 10 years.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sth. so that it is exactly right for sb.'s particular needs or for a particular purpose 根据特定需要制作；定做
explanations_and_examples.example: Most travel agents are willing to tailor travel arrangements to meet individual requirements.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: repeat (another's words, ideas, etc.) 附和
explanations_and_examples.example: Her feelings are echoed by other parents whose kids have left home.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if a sound echoes, you hear it again because it was made near sth. such as a wall or hill （声音）回响；发出回声
explanations_and_examples.example: Her footsteps echoed in the empty room.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a feeling of extreme unhappiness 忧虑；苦恼；悲伤
explanations_and_examples.example: Luke's poor academic performance caused his parents great distress.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a tune, esp. the main tune in a piece of music written for several instruments or voices 旋律；曲调；（尤指）主旋律
explanations_and_examples.example: They played some lovely melodies at the end of the concert.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] sth. that is a feature of only one particular place, person, situation, etc. （某地方、某人或某情况等的）特点，独特性
explanations_and_examples.example: A sharp ringing in the ears is a peculiarity of the disease.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: think sb. / sth. is unpleasant and not like them 不喜欢；讨厌
explanations_and_examples.example: He disliked it when she phoned him so late at night.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] 催产素
1) write a piece of music 作（曲）
explanations_and_examples.example: Mozart composed his last opera shortly before he passed away.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (be composed of) be formed from a number of substances, parts, or people 由...组成
explanations_and_examples.example: The committee is composed of doctors, nurses and members of the public.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE also personalised) adapted to personal requirements or tastes 个性化的
explanations_and_examples.example: His car has a personalized number plate.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: apart from sb. / sth.; in addition to sb. / sth. 除...之外（还）
explanations_and_examples.example: I've got no family besides my parents.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: be even better or greater than sb. / sth. else 超过；胜过
explanations_and_examples.example: The film's success has surpassed all expectations.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: be more successful than sb. / sth. else 做得比...好；胜过
explanations_and_examples.example: In recent years, our economy has outperformed most other industrial economies.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: rational thoughts, decisions, etc. are based on reasons rather than emotions （想法、决定等）合理的，基于理性的
explanations_and_examples.example: Parents need to be fully informed before they can make a rational decision.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: relating to the natural processes performed by living things 生物的；与生物有关的
explanations_and_examples.example: Breathing and sleeping are examples of biological rhythms in humans.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: relating to genes or genetics 基因的；遗传学的
explanations_and_examples.example: I'm giving a seminar on the latest developments in genetic research next week.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] an extremely small living thing which can only be seen if you use a microscope. Some microbes can cause diseases. 微生物
explanations_and_examples.example: Was it not the duty of the doctor to kill the microbes?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that is based on feelings rather than facts or proof 基于直觉地
explanations_and_examples.example: She had sensed, intuitively, that Larry was interested in her.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that shows you are happy or pleased to do sth. or that you do not object to doing sth. 欣然地；愿意地；乐意地
explanations_and_examples.example: Sixty percent of voters said they would willingly pay higher taxes for better health care.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] 西兰花
move your body quickly away from sb. / sth. because you find them or it frightening or unpleasant 退缩；畏缩
explanations_and_examples.example: Howard recoiled a little at the sharpness in my voice.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a feeling of great shock, fear, or disgust 震惊；惊恐；厌恶
explanations_and_examples.example: The thought of being left alone filled her with horror.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a feeling that sb. / sth. is unpleasant or morally offensive 不喜欢；厌恶；反感
explanations_and_examples.example: She was trying her best not to show her distaste.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of sth. （相似物体之间的）差异；（数量或形式的）变化，变动
explanations_and_examples.example: There might be striking variations within a species.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. pl.] 味蕾
[C] a nerve ending which receives information about changes in light, heat, etc. and causes the body to react in particular ways 感受器；受体
explanations_and_examples.example: In the year 2000, taste receptors that detect this chemical were discovered on the tongue.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] 硫脲
more than enough in quantity 丰富的；充足的
explanations_and_examples.example: I provided a plentiful supply of games to keep the children occupied.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (deoxyribonucleic acid) 脱氧核糖核酸
extremely unpleasant and making you feel sick 令人恶心的；使人极其反感的；令人厌恶的
explanations_and_examples.example: The kitchen was in a disgusting state when she left.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: fair, practical, and sensible 有道理的；合情合理的
explanations_and_examples.example: Be reasonable — you can't expect her to do all the work on her own!

explanations_and_examples.explanation: reduce sb.'s pain or unpleasant feelings 减轻；缓解 ( 疼痛或不快的感觉 )
explanations_and_examples.example: This kind of drug can help to relieve the pain, but it should be used carefully.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: feeling happy because you are no longer worried about sth. 宽慰的；放心的
explanations_and_examples.example: She looked immensely relieved when she heard the news.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: an innate quality or ability is sth. you are born with （素质或能力）天生的，与生俱来的
explanations_and_examples.example: Children seem to have an innate ability to learn language.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) sexually attractive 性感迷人的
explanations_and_examples.example: He was with the young woman whom his classmates thought most desirable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (fml.) sth. that is desirable is worth having or doing 理想的；值得拥有的；值得做的
explanations_and_examples.example: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] (infml.) a husband, wife, or other sexual partner 丈夫；妻子；配偶；性伴侣
explanations_and_examples.example: Many matchmaking sites compile lists of potential mates using basic information.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C] sb. you work with, do an activity with, or share sth. with 同事；同伴
explanations_and_examples.example: Some of my office mates are planning to throw a party for me.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (esp. of a woman or part of her body) having an attractive or well-proportioned shape （尤指女子或其部分身体）好看的，匀称的
explanations_and_examples.example: She was about my age and had long, shapely legs and a beautiful smile.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: shining and flashing with light 闪亮的；闪光的
explanations_and_examples.example: This is a region of sparkling lakes, rushing streams, and dense forests.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very pleasing in appearance or sound 好看的；好听的；有吸引力的
explanations_and_examples.example: I thought he was very attractive and obviously very intelligent.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: relating to the way in which plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time 进化的
explanations_and_examples.example: Some scholars are keen to see evolutionary theory challenged in university lecture halls.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: almost 几乎
explanations_and_examples.example: This kind of bird has become virtually extinct in most of the country.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if an animal or plant reproduces, or reproduces itself, it produces young plants or animals 生殖；繁殖
explanations_and_examples.example: Many single cell organisms reproduce by splitting in two.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: relating to being a parent and esp. to being responsible for a child's safety and development 父亲的；母亲的；父母的
explanations_and_examples.example: Parental consent is required before the operation can take place.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (pl. offspring) sb.'s child or children — often used humorously （某人的）子女，子孙，后代（常为幽默用法）
explanations_and_examples.example: Tom's sister came over on Saturday with all her offspring.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a lack of interest 无兴趣
explanations_and_examples.example: The exception to Tom's disinterest in social issues was education.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 器官
making you lose hope and determination 令人灰心的；令人气馁的
explanations_and_examples.example: It is disheartening to see what little progress has been made.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (not before noun) seeming certain to happen at some time in the future 注定的；必然的
explanations_and_examples.example: He feels that he is destined to become a musician, just like his father.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (be a ~ of / to sth.) be so strongly influenced by sth. that you cannot make your own decisions — used to show disapproval 成为某事物的奴隶，完全受某事物控制（含贬义）
explanations_and_examples.example: How can she not see that she has become a slave of fashion?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) sb. who is owned by another person and works for them for no money 奴隶
explanations_and_examples.example: By the time I was 10, I had become her slave, doing all the housework.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: extremely attractive and impressive; deserving praise 壮丽的；宏伟的；值得赞扬的
explanations_and_examples.example: I think he deserves congratulations for a magnificent job well done.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [vt.] 1) deal with a problem or improve a bad situation 解决；补救；纠正；改善
explanations_and_examples.example: To remedy the situation, the water must be chemically treated.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [n.][C] 2) a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better （问题的）解决方式；（糟糕状况的）补救方法
explanations_and_examples.example: There is no simple remedy for unemployment.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a strong feeling of sympathy for sb. who is suffering, and a desire to help them 怜悯；同情
explanations_and_examples.example: He was filled with overwhelming love and compassion for his wife.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: the type of work sb. does 专业；行业
explanations_and_examples.example: You can expect to meet some very interesting people in my line of work.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: later in the future, not immediately 从长远来看
explanations_and_examples.example: It seems a lot of effort but I'm sure it's the best solution in the long run.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to describe what will happen a short time in the future 短期内
explanations_and_examples.example: This decision will cost us more in the short term, but will be beneficial in the long term.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to emphasize that sb. has human feelings or weaknesses, often when contrasting them with machines 血肉之躯
explanations_and_examples.example: I am only flesh and blood, like anyone else.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: search or examine sth. very carefully 仔细搜查（检查）某物
explanations_and_examples.example: Go over your work before you hand it in.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (esp. AmE) realize and understand sth. such as your feelings and attitudes 认识到某事物，了解某事物（如自己的情感、态度等）
explanations_and_examples.example: I am finally able to get in touch with who I am.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: become less sad, or make sb. feel less sad （使）高兴起来；（使）振作起来
explanations_and_examples.example: Here is a bit of news that will cheer you up.

children.word: sb.'s heart skips / misses a beat

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to say sb. suddenly feels a moment of fear, excitement, etc. 某人心跳停顿了一下（表示突然感到惊恐、兴奋等）
explanations_and_examples.example: My heart skipped a beat when I saw who it was.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: remove sth. when you are preparing a book, a piece of film, etc. for printing or broadcasting （在编辑、剪辑等过程中）删除，去掉
explanations_and_examples.example: Anything offensive will be edited out at a later stage of the production.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: use a feeling, fact, or idea in order to get what you want, often in an unfair way 利用（某一感情、事实或观点）
explanations_and_examples.example: The advertisement plays on our emotions, showing a doctor holding a newborn baby.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: become popular and fashionable 流行
explanations_and_examples.example: The idea of glasses being a fashion item has been slow to catch on.

children.word: stand / have a chance / hope (of doing sth.)

explanations_and_examples.explanation: be likely to be able to do sth. or to succeed 有机会/有希望（做某事）
explanations_and_examples.example: She will stand a chance of passing the exam if she works hard.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if sth. makes sense, there seems to be a good reason or explanation for it 解释得通；有道理
explanations_and_examples.example: Why did she do a thing like that? It doesn't seem to make sense.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: try to find out about sth. unknown or secret 探究； 探寻
explanations_and_examples.example: When you dig into the data a bit though, things look gloomier.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: have an idea or discover sth. suddenly or unexpectedly 突然想出（主意）；无意中发现（某事）
explanations_and_examples.example: When we first hit upon the idea, everyone told us it would never work.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: start to love sb. very much 爱上某人
explanations_and_examples.example: The minute we met I knew this was the girl I wanted to give my heart to.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: concerning sb. / sth. 关于某事
explanations_and_examples.example: Frank was very uncertain as to whether it was the right job for him.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very unhappy because sb. has sth. that you want 十分忌妒；眼红
explanations_and_examples.example: Chad is heading off to Spain for the week, and I'm green with envy.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: start doing sth. or making plans to do sth. in order to achieve a particular result （为达到某个结果而）开始做某事，着手进行
explanations_and_examples.example: He has achieved what he set out to do three years ago.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (spoken) if sb. says they are on the case, they know about a problem and are going to try to solve it 负责处理某事；负责解决某事
explanations_and_examples.example: We need to book a flight before it's too late.  Don't worry, I'm on the case.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to say sth. is impossible for sb. to control 无法控制
explanations_and_examples.example: There was nothing we could do about it — the situation was beyond our control.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: support sb. / sth. 给予支持
explanations_and_examples.example: The president is lending support to the governor's re-election campaign.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: get upset by the things other people say or do, because you think that their remarks or behaviors are directed at you in particular 因认为某人的言行针对自己而不快
explanations_and_examples.example: Don't take it personally; she is rude to everyone.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 莫扎特（奥地利作曲家）
苹果音乐商店（由苹果公司营运的线上商店，提供音乐、电视、电影等媒体的下载服务）
莎士比亚（英国剧作家、诗人）
弗丽达・卡洛（墨西哥画家）
碧昂斯（美国流行音乐歌手）
布兰妮・斯皮尔斯（美国流行音乐歌手）
